models

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.UserManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class provides methods for user management. Every instance of this class contains a reference to the associated set of users and a reference to the current user.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • initializeUser

        public void initializeUser(java.lang.String username,
                  char[] rawPassword)
        Creates new user with a given username and password. The user is automatically added to the user set.
        Parameters:
        username - string representing the username.
        rawPassword - char array representing the password.

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Returns current user.
        Returns:
        current user.

      • setCurrentUser

        public void setCurrentUser(User user)
        Sets a given user as the current user.
        Parameters:
        user - user to be set as the current user.

      • validateUser

        public User validateUser(java.lang.String username,
                char[] rawPassword)
        Validates and returns user with a given name and password.
        Parameters:
        username - string representing the username.
        rawPassword - char array representing the password.
        Returns:
        user with the given username and password, null if there is no such user.

      • getByUsername

        public User getByUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Returns user with a given username.
        See Also:
        UserSet.getByUsername(String)

      • all

        public UserSet all()
        Creates and returns new user set containing all users in the associated user set.
        See Also:
        UserSet.all()

      • getUsernames

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getUsernames()
        Returns vector containing names of all users in this set.
        See Also:
        UserSet.getUsernames()

      • add

        public boolean add(User user)
        Adds a given user to the associated user set.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be added
        Returns:
        true if the set did not already contain the specified user

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.String username,
             char[] rawPassword)
        Removes user with a given username and password. User is first validated with validateUser method.
        Parameters:
        username - string representing the username.
        rawPassword - char array representing the password.
        Returns:
        true if removing was successful, false if there is no such user.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns string representation of this user manager.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of this user manager.
